features: GO THE DISTANCE: Withstand whatever adventure with the wildly reliable T7 Shield; It’s designed for the elements with water1, dust2 and drop3 resistance—all, of course, at lightning speeds

YOUR CONTENT CAPTURED: Take on the project, then transfer all your heavy files within seconds with the USB 3.2 Gen 2 Portable Solid-State Drive; Compatible with PC, Mac, Android devices, gaming consoles and more
SHARE IDEAS IN A FLASH: The T7 is embedded with PCIe NVME technology that brings you fast read and write speeds up to 1,050/1,000 MB/s4, making it almost twice as fast as the T5

MAKE ROOM FOR MEMORIES: Forge your own path with a full range of storage capacities; Keep all your prized files in one place with options from 1TB to 4TB; Pack in more personal content or store your biggest tasks on this palm-sized SSD

BRAVE THE ELEMENTS: Get it done, rain or shine. With an IP65 rating for water1 and dust2 resistance, this SSD is ready to rough it; So even when you’ve got a dreary-day deadline, you can keep your projects in perfect condition
YOUR ADVENTURE'S ADVANTAGE: Secure the shot with the drop resistant T7 Shield. Its rugged design adds extra durability with protection from falls up to 9.8 feet so you can dare to reach higher5

SAMSUNG MAGICIAN SOFTWARE: Get the most out of your SSD with Samsung Magician's advanced yet intuitive optimization tools; Monitor drive health, protect valuable data, receive important updates and set up LED color combinations

WORLD’S #1 FLASH MEMORY BRAND: Performance and reliability from the world’s #1 brand for flash memory since 20036; All firmware and components are produced in-house, including our world renowned DRAM and NAND, for quality and you can trust
SUPPORTS iPHONE: Supports iPhone 15 Pro Res 4K at 60fps video and more7; Included SSD cable recommended
body.description: Samsung T7 Shield Portable SSD delivers high performance on-the-go, not matter the terrain. It has an IP65 rating for water1 and dust2 resistance, with Dynamic Thermal Guard to manage heat control. Transfer huge files instantly. USB 3.2 Gen 2 and PCIe® NVMe achieve soaring sequential read/write speeds of up to 1,050/1,000 MB/s4, allowing you to edit directly from the drive. The rugged design and advanced outer elastomer add extra durability to even endure a 9.8 foot drop3. The T7 Shield is compatible with PC, Mac, Android devices, gaming consoles, and more. 1Consistent with IP65 rating, tested under controlled conditions: water flow of 100kPa for 3 minutes. Water resistant capabilities may vary depending on the actual conditions. 2Consistent with IP65 rating, tested under controlled conditions: 2kg/m³ of active dust with a pressure under 2kPa for 8 hours. Dust resistant capabilities may vary depending on the actual conditions. 3Tested to withstand 9.8-ft (3 meters) drop under controlled conditions. Drop resistance capability may vary depending on the actual environmental conditions. 4Performance may vary depending on host configuration. To reach maximum read/write speeds of up to 1,050/1,000 MB/s, respectively, the host device and connection cables must support USB 3.2 Gen 2 and the UASP mode must be enabled. 5Tested to withstand 9.8-ft (3 meters) drop under controlled conditions. Drop resistance capability may vary depending on the actual environmental conditions. 6Source: 2003-2022 OMDIA data: NAND suppliers' revenue market share. 7Included SSD cable recommended.

reviews.reviewerName: AOP3D 5 WHISTLESTOP MALL  ROCKPORT MAAOP3D 5 WHISTLESTOP MALL  ROCKPORT MA
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars aop3d loves this ssd
reviews.reviewText: Title: Exceptional Performance and Rugged Reliability - A Game-Changer for Creators!Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐I recently purchased the Samsung T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD, and I must say it has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. As a photographer and content creator, my workflow demands both high-speed data transfer and reliable durability, and the T7 Shield delivers on both fronts with flying colors.**Performance (5/5):**The T7 Shield's lightning-fast data transfer speeds, boasting up to 1050MB/s, make file transfers a breeze. Whether I'm working with large RAW photo files or editing high-resolution videos, the T7 Shield significantly reduces wait times, allowing me to focus on the creative process rather than data transfer limitations. The USB 3.2 Gen2 interface ensures a seamless connection to my devices, and I appreciate the versatility it offers for a wide range of applications.**Rugged Design (5/5):**The T7 Shield's rugged design is a standout feature. Its IP65 water and dust resistance provide peace of mind, especially when working in unpredictable environments. I've taken it on outdoor shoots, and it has withstood everything from light rain to dusty conditions without a hiccup. The sturdy aluminum exterior not only looks sleek but also adds an extra layer of durability, protecting my valuable data from unexpected bumps and drops.**Capacity (5/5):**The 4TB storage capacity is a game-changer for creators dealing with large files. It accommodates my growing library of high-resolution photos and 4K videos, offering ample space for my creative projects. The fact that such a substantial amount of storage is packed into a portable form factor is a testament to Samsung's commitment to meeting the needs of professionals and enthusiasts alike.**Compatibility (5/5):**The T7 Shield's compatibility with a variety of devices, including PCs, Macs, and gaming consoles, makes it a versatile solution for my multi-device workflow. I've seamlessly used it across different platforms without any compatibility issues, and the plug-and-play functionality ensures a hassle-free experience.**Portability (5/5):**Weighing in at just a few ounces and boasting a compact design, the T7 Shield is the epitome of portability. It slips easily into my pocket or camera bag, allowing me to carry my work wherever I go. The included USB-C to USB-C and USB-C to USB-A cables add to the convenience, ensuring that I can connect it to a variety of devices without needing additional accessories.In conclusion, the Samsung T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD is a stellar investment for photographers, content creators, and gamers alike. Its exceptional performance, rugged design, ample capacity, broad compatibility, and unmatched portability make it a must-have tool for anyone serious about their creative endeavors. Samsung has once again raised the bar in the world of portable SSDs, and the T7 Shield has become an indispensable part of my creative toolkit. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great little dervice
reviews.reviewText: a real step up from my Seagate storage, the clucky ones with the fat USB ends that took the horrific Micro B USB 3, with the dual ports, so difficult to plug in and easy to strip, big bulky cords, big bulky drives, and very prone to just freezing up and mine did. Not a solid state as my nifty new little T7 is. I could not be happier with the speed, size, function, reliability, packability, waterproofing, and overall superiority of the T7 product from what I have had in the past. It is light years ahead and a joy to use. The USB C is a delight, the color is lovely, and the price was very reasonable for 2 T as well. Thrilled with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My first pc was a state of the art, dual floppy drive IBM; it was 1984. I had to swap out floppy disks for different functions (e.g., spell check). My last external hard drive was not yet a solid state; it now makes a good doorstop. This drive is amazing: speed, capacity, portability, and price! I was so happy with its performance as an archive drive that I know have a second one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well Made, Fast and Reliable Storage
reviews.reviewText: I have several of these Samsung drives, and have found them to be rock solid in build quality, as well as supporting very fast data transfers. Unlike SSDs I own from another well-known brand, these barely get warm after transferring large amounts of data, which is reassuring. The Shield versions of the T7 drives are a bit larger in size compared with the standard versions, but this is due to their more robust construction and heat dissipation design.I use these for backups of various MacBook laptops we own, as well as storage of large media files. So far they've all worked flawlessly. It's important to use the cables that come with the drive (USB C-C and USB C-A) or their equivalent, as the transfer rate can be significantly slower with cheaper, run of the mill USB C cables.I like the feel of these in my hand, which may seem like a strange thing to say, but their ridges are easier to grab onto than the smoother aluminum finish on the standard version. This means it feels like I'm less likely to drop them. Smooth is nice and looks more sleek, but I think a more "grippy" surface is better when carrying your data around.Oddly enough, I was recently able to get a number of these drives for less money than the standard versions, which I was happy to take advantage of. I'm thinking some people might not prefer them because they are a bit bigger and less elegant looking, but they look that way for a reason. Physical robustness is more important than looks in a storage device.I think Samsung is one of the very best manufacturers of SSD drives right now, so I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone looking for reliable data storage and very fast transfer rates.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Small, Fast, Better
reviews.reviewText: Bought the Samsung HD because they are supposed to have great customer service but thankfully I haven’t needed it. Very small and exceptionally fast, especially if you are used to the old HDs everyone is used to. Got this because I transfer a lot of video and some of it from an old, cranky Mac. This HD has made a huge difference in the speed needed for transfers and made the old Mac more usable. Nice, rubberized casing for a durable piece of equipment. Getting ready to transfer all of my external HD needs to SSDs because there are no moving parts, which, according to tech pros I have talked to, can only help in the long term.
Excelente disco, rapidísimo, ligero, pequeño y portátil a buen precio, materiales de muy alta calidad y durabilidad

Portabilidad 10/10Diseño 10/10Rapidez de transmisión de datos (con los puertos high speed compatibles) 9.5/10Factor durabilidad contra caídas, water and dust resistance 10/10 (lo mejor del producto en mi opinión)Relación precio/calidad 9/10Lo recomiendo

Excelente Drive externo pra quem tem um iPhone 15 pro, além de gravar videos a 4 K 60 frames , dá show de armazenamento e show na transferência entre ele e o notebook pela porta USB C 3.2 Tô comprando outro pra minha filha.

This tiny SSD drive is compact, well built, soft to the touch and lightning fast. I waited for it to be on special and my wish was granted. Thank you Black Friday! This is the 2 TB version, enough to backup my IPhone 15 pro Max 512GB and to carry a few extras. I’m wondering if I could save my PS5 games on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Até aqui não há o que posso dizer negativamente.
reviews.reviewText: Ótimo produto, funcionamento perfeito no Mac.
